reviews.review_msg: He cares about everyone understanding so by the second midterm we were 6 lectures behind due to small questions derailing whole lectures. First midterm was really hard and most people failed, second midterm he put lots of bonus marks and made it relatively easy, final was curved and replaced my first midterm.

erol goat. scaled like crazy hes my goat [C- to A-]. one time he jumped in the air to point at smth on the screen and i knew this was gonna be the best semester of my life. hes my goat the test are so easy if u study and hes so funny i could never hate him.
The first midterm average was below passing. There's a lot of online homework, the lectures were boring, and the course is generally just hard.

The timing of when we learned things was unorganized. Practice tests and lecture iClicker questions, and TA tutorials are useful. Homework isn't useful. I had to rely on my friends to teach me because I couldn't understand the professor's explanations. This class is really challenging, particularly if you're taking it concurrently with math.

He is an okay professor, very disorganized and behind on lecs, hard to access through email. Because of that he grades very nicely, curved this class very hard. The exams content was mainly through lecs and previous exams. Just stay organized and good luck.

I really like him—he clearly cares about his students and always makes sure everyone understands the material by regularly checking in with us. He's not strict with grading, and he curves, which definitely helps. His online homework is very helpful too. I would definitely take another class with him.

His teaching was absolutely terrible, he was way behind the achieve pre lectures and it started to get very confusing as you learned different stuff in the lectures and pre lectures. His hw questions are also more than 50% stuff that he hasn't even taught. However, this all really nullifies since he is a easy grader and basically curves everything.
His lectures were disorganized and confusing. I prob learned more of off YouTube than actually going to his lectures. He also gave out a LOT of achieve hw… Marking wise, he's easy going..

He is not coordinated with the pre-lectures. I do not recommend taking this class with him unless you want to be confused because he is 4 lectures behind. I recommend watching other professors' lectures. He does curve midterms and isn't a harsh grader when the class average is low.

I took this in spring 2024. He is nice and would hold an online session before each midterm but his teaching was not good. He also had iclickers. Honestly, like people say on here, he cares for his students but for a class that is supposed to teach grade 12 phys it was concerning. He curves everything though.

Erol seems like a nice guy, his teaching methods are confusing and not very clear. Take physics with simin it is much easier. Erol seems like he could be good at teaching an advanced physics class, but he makes the basics quite confusing.
I have no idea how I passed, good thing is that he curves. His explanations during class were never clear to me, I didn't understand anything at all.
This dude cannot teach and his exams are pretty bad but he curves crazy for the midterms and finals. He over complicates everything. Don't take physics with this prof

He's a good guy and I can tell he genuinely wants his student to succeed, but is wildly unprepared ( finds errors in his slides mid lecture, contradicts himself mid explanation, unable to help with any course material other than examples in slides). Language barrier does not help. Scales tho

Although his lectures could be boring at times, I would say that this prof is definitely passionate about what he does and goes out of his way to support students. Much of his exams were straight from in-class examples and tutorial questions. Just attend his review sessions and go over past questions and you'll do just fine.

Erol is a very fair professor and clearly wants his students to succeed. Although his lectures were quite boring, they seemed to be directly related to what was on the tests. He curved so hard so don't worry about one bad grade!
Review sessions before the midterms are very helpful and so are the open labs. He scales the class alot so dont let your current grade discourage you

Although his lectures aren't the easiest to understand, he genuinely cares for his students and tries his best to make sure you understand any questions you have outside of class. He also scales so much!!
Would take again. He marks very fair and scales SOOOOOO MUCH

Erol is not as bad as people make him to be. I would say a con is that he doesnt reply to emails. There are SOO many resources given in which you can learn the material. I think alot of people in my class just did not prioritize studying because the avg for one of our midterms was originally 40% (before scaling). Just dont be lazy and study :)

I would not recommend this professor to any student looking to take PHYS100.
Erol is extremely disorganized and difficult to understand. His explanations and work on lectures make topics unnecessarily complicated. I resorted to using YouTube videos and other online programs to teach myself the course as Erol was ineffective in his teaching style.

Makes you really question if anything related to science is worth it. Not the greatest at explaining most concepts and gets triggered if students dont fully grasp the concept the first time. Likes to ask the students questions during zoom classes which only creates an awkward silence in the already painful and confusing class

Girt is a kind prof (hence the 2/5) but he really needs to be more organized. I understand that teaching physics 100 is relatively new to him, however he should've been better prepared and be more willing to take on questions from his students.

Get ready to teach yourself! Exams are brutal and unrelated to the concepts taught. Tutorials were pointless, didn't answer his emails and disorganized lectures. He really shouldn't be teaching. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

I did relatively well in Phys11 and just needed the Phys 12 credit, thinking this would be a breeze. Really isn't. He seems caring about his students, but does not answer his emails, and his exams were nothing like what we have done in class. They are exponentially harder, even for an online exam. Not fair if you do not cheat and are honest :(

Very nice man, very flexible with due dates, tests are pretty fair,however the course seemed very scrambled to me, lectures were not very engaging learned everything myself. It was his first time teaching phys100 but for me personally it was just hard to follow his teaching style and all the course information just felt scrambled around in my head.

While he really is a fun and caring person, what makes this class difficult is that he is very inaccessible. In the first week, he stated that he won't be checking any emails because there are too many students. The lectures are fine, except he includes problems from a higher-level course, which doesn't help.

He's a genuinely funny and kind person. However, he doesn't teach clearly. Get ready to teach urself most of the topics covered and then do exceeding level Q's on exams. He expects u to know a lot already and explains concepts using calculus notations from MATH151. If ur not already well versed in basic concepts in phys and calc, get a diff prof.

Erol's lecture will often have you laughing but unfortunately he doesn't teach the content very well. It is difficult to understand what he says and his writing isn't very legible either. Erol does truly care for his students but that attitude isn't reflected in his lectures as it seems that not much effort has gone into the presentation.

If you have trouble with accents. /RUN/. The course would have been a lot easier had I understood what he was saying half of the time. Additionally, he spoke with broken English. Definitely go to TA hours if you want to pass.
Good luck. Get a tutor.

Has thick accent, and mumbles on top of this so very difficult to understand. Homework is easy, tests are really hard. Lectures are useless because he derives formulae and thats it, and you never have to do this on tests. Homework due dates were changed constantly, and sometimes homework was due two lectures before we would talk about the topic.
What makes things more fun is the fact that he is Bucky Barnes in the avengers. He skipped filming to teach class, and that shows his commitment to the students

Erol means well, but I really didn't learn in his lectures. Reading the pre-lectures gave me confidence in knowing the material, but then he would blow that confidence out of the water with overcomplicated solutions (so much so that he kept messing up during review for the final). Mastering the tutorial questions is necessary to get a stellar mark.
Available after hours and honestly cares about the students. Explains concepts through a lot of examples and takes feedback from students wholeheartedly.
Explains concepts very poorly and is not entirely knowledgeable on the subjects he teaches. Puts very little effort into lecture slides.
I found his tests relatively easy so long as you were comfortable solving the questions given on tutorials.

Erol is fantastic! Never met a professor who cared so much for his students. He is very easy going and very easy to approach. Exams were very fair if you practiced the tutorial questions and made use of all the amazing resources they made available like exam prep sessions, and weekly open tutorials with the various TAs.

He does a lot of complicated proofs of formulas during class, which is nice for those that enjoy physics, though not essential, since they are not on the exam.  His lectures are decent, though his main strength is his willingness to provide extra help after class. I wish every professor could be so easy to reach after class.
Hard to understand what he's saying because of his accent. The tests scale went from Midterm 1- easy Midterm2 - easy Final- Super super super hard.
Midterms are quite easy so long as you practice the assigned work.  Tutorials are well structured and provide all the relevant material for the exams.

He's alright. Typical academic in  the fact that lectures are pointless and full of overcomplicated baloney. He differs from other academics however, in the fact that his tests are pretty fair. I zoned out and played on my phone during class (went for iclicker) and aced the course just by doing my own thing

Awesome guy, English is not his first language, so lectures do get a bit confusing sometimes, but is more than happy to help you during office hours. It seems like he really tries hard to help everyone pass as much as he can.
He talks with an accent but is really helpful and nice guy.

I would say that he made phy 321 bearable......otherwise it is considered o the 2nd hardest course in sfu lol. Try all the assignment questions and do all the examples from the lecture note and u will be fine.
The guy is nice and smart, but he can't seem to explain concepts qualitatively. Uses math to explain new things and just assumes that it makes sense and is obvious.
Really nice guy, super helpful. But it's a tough course. Attend lectures. Problems mostly from book and lectures.

His lectures are boring at times, and spends time going over derivations. However, the midterms and finals were based very much on in class examples, so attending lecture is helpful.  Also very helpful if you ask him questions during his office hours.
Really helpful prof. Not that good at explaining material though he will try to make you understand
Soooo nice, will help you pass (Y)

He is not that bad :)He just started teaching, and has some organization probelm. He scales alot, so if u want a good grade, u should take his class., but if u wanna learn then avoid him at all cost, bcoz u dont leran anything

Most of the time he would try and and prove equations, but he would forget how to do so. Get used to the saying "trust me". The final exam was out of 60. After the first hour he saw it was going terribly and said it was out of 55. When it was marked it was out of 50 and everyone was given an additional six bonus marks.
He wasn't clear while lecturing. I was even more confused after lectures then before. Didn't explain format of exams, emails answering questions were unclear. Not a good profersor at all!
